title: Simon Mignolet is officially the Premier League's best goalkeeper… when facing penalties
text:
Simon Mignolet is officially the Premier League's best goalkeeper… when facing penalties The Liverpool keeper's record when it comes to facing spot-kicks is surprisingly good Share Simon Mignolet redeems himself in spectacular fashion (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Liverpool FC   Could   
Simon Mignolet had a VERY mixed night during the 1-1 draw against Chelsea. 
At half-time, Liverpool fans were cursing his name, after his bizarre decision to not bother trying to save David Luiz's belting free-kick. 
At full-time, Liverpool fans were filled with nothing but love for him, after he secured their team a point by saving Diego Costa's late penalty. "HOW YOU LIKE ME NOW, TWITTER?" (Photo: REUTERS) 
It was quite a turnaround in fortunes for the Belgian stopper - thanks largely to his penalty heroics. In fact, a closer look at Mignolet's record over the years suggests that, if he could simply face a few more spot-kicks he would get a LOT more love from the Anfield faithful. 
Incredibly, Mignolet has now saved SEVEN penalties since the start of hte 2011/12 season - and that is considerably more than any other Premier League keeper in that time: Premier League penalty saves since 2011/12 So, is Mignolet a butter-fingered, flaky-wristed liberty in the Liverpool goal? Or is he a spot-kick saving super stopper? Hmm… Who should be Liverpool's first choice keeper? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
